title: Founding Lead Computer Vision Engineer
description:
We are on a mission to make everything you see shoppable, starting with what you watch. Silvr lets you shop outfits and accessories that you see on TV without the friction of a second screen. Powered by our proprietary fashion recognition and recommendation model, Silvr's white labeled technology allows consumers to purchase products while they're viewing and most inspired to transact.

We believe that Silvr will set the bar for how we experience and engage with content, and we'd love for you to join us on our journey!

Position Overview:

In this fully remote role, you will be a founding member of the Silvr team, pioneering and leading the research, development, and training of Silvr's computer vision models. You will work closely with our eCommerce lead, our Data Engineering team to ensure Silvr's model and eCommerce platform work together seamlessly. You will work directly with both founders to build and contribute to the company-wide vision and future technology.

Key Responsibilities:

Hands-on Development
• Research, design, develop, and implement computer vision algorithms that solve object detection, image recognition, and video analysis
• Optimize and deploy computer vision models for performance and scalability in production environments
• Analyze and preprocess large datasets to train, validate, and test models effectively
• Debug and improve existing computer vision systems to enhance accuracy and efficiency
• Write clear, maintainable, and documented code with a focus on high performance and usability
• Conducting research in the computer vision domain to stay up-to-date with the latest advancements and incorporate into the Silvr platform

Team Leadership
• Guide and grow a team of data scientists, data engineers and other computer vision engineers, fostering a collaborative and innovative team culture
• Manage project timelines, allocate resources, and ensure deliverables are met
• Work collaboratively with software engineers, data engineers, and product managers to integrate computer vision capabilities into our products

Requirements:
• Work VISA/Permit for USA or Canada
• Experience guiding other engineers, ensuring projects are completed efficiently while fostering collaboration and technical excellence
• 3+ years of relevant computer vision experience; preferably in the ecommerce, retail or fashion industry
• Bachelor and/or Master's degree (Ph.D. a plus) in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field, or equivalent work experience
• Strong experience in developing and implementing computer vision algorithms and machine learning models; preferably in real-time systems
• Proficiency in programming languages like Python, C++, or Java
• Hands-on experience with frameworks and libraries such as OpenCV, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar
• Solid understanding of deep learning architectures (CNNs, RNNs) and computer vision concepts
• Familiarity and curiosity around new approaches for image processing techniques and working with large-scale datasets
• Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently as well as part of a team
• Experience with cloud platforms like AWS, GCP, or Azure for deploying vision models.
• Familiarity with tools and techniques for model optimization, such as quantization and pruning
• Understanding of GPU programming and parallel computing

Why Join Us?

At Silvr we infuse our work with joy and we prioritize wellbeing. We experience new challenges everyday (truly), and that keeps us energized to tackle the work ahead of us. Got an idea of how to improve things? Have a solution nobody has thought of? We want to hear it! At Silvr, our people are our priority. We're creating a culture where you will feel supported and inspired daily. Silvr is a fun, dynamic environment where you'll be solving a puzzle that nobody has solved (and many have tried), and that will give you the opportunity to grow and make a lasting impact. We know diverse ideas and contributions make us stronger—it took three different people to write this—and we're committed to making sure everyone feels valued and included as we build something groundbreaking together.

We're big on transparency; when we make decisions, you'll always know why. Our founders are deeply involved in the day-to-day and maintain an open-door policy to ensure everyone feels connected to the vision. If you have a question about our progress, a solution to a problem, or a picture of your pet that needs to be shown off, you can always find us.

We love our work, and we also understand that life doesn't fit neatly into a 9-to-5 schedule. That's why we're fully remote and flexible to meet the needs of our team. Whether it's family, appointments, or personal commitments, we trust our people to manage their time in a way that works for them. At Silvr, you'll be part of a close-knit team that values fun, flexibility, freedom, and a commitment to world changing innovation.

In addition to the above, we offer all employees a competitive salary, paid time off, and benefits package, including equity.

Silvr is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. All employment decisions are based on qualifications, merit, and business needs.
